page.title: 06BURTON DISTRICT HOSPITAL
page.content: The hospital was finished in 1971 and opened in June by Princess Margaret . There is accomodation for 250 nurses and doctors.There are beds for 400 patients and the hospital costs 283,000 pounds to run each week.The hospital covers the whole of East Staffordshire and parts of Derby,Tamworth and Leicestershire.There are 80 doctors, 600 nurses and 700 ancillary staff.When we went on a tour we saw the X-ray rooms and the store where they keep the medicines. In the Physiotherapy Dept. we saw the machines used to treat injuries.In winter about 30 people are treated per day,in summer more patients are admitted because more people go out. The newest piece of equipment in use is a laser used to X-ray pregnant women. All the staff and the people who were in the hospital seemed happy and cheerful.
